title: Setting up the Integral: Area of one Cross-Sectional Square
text: The area of one of the cross-sectional squares is $$A(x)=s^2={\left(\frac{ax}{h}\right)}^2$$. The integral for the volume of the pyramid is $$V=\int_{0}^{h} A(x) \,dx=\int_{0}^{h} {\left(\frac{a x}{h}\right)}^2 \,dx=(a**2/h**2)*/int(x**2),0,h,x}$$.
